required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Validation of a Newly Developed Sham Press Needle
clinical_study.official_title: Validation of a Newly Developed Sham Press Needle

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single blind randomised controlled trial involving healthy volunteers to determine feasibility and blinding property of two types of sham press needles.

detailed_description.textblock: A total of 84 healthy volunteers will be recruited and randomly allocated to receive real needles (RN), previously validated Kim Sham needles (KS), or newly developed Ring Sham needles (RS) at a 1:1:1 ratio. Acupuncture sensation, blinding, and feasibility in a future clinical trial will be measured along with other physiological measurements including tactile sensitivity, interoceptive sensitivity, and electrodermal activity.

primary_outcome.time_frame: After needling on the 1st day visit
primary_outcome.description: Blinding property will be evaluated: the participants will be asked 'which type of acupuncture do you think you have received?' and choose 1 answer out of real, sham, or don't know.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: On the next day visit (1 day after needling)
secondary_outcome.description: It will be assessed whether sham press needle remains in place for at least 2 days (yes/no).

secondary_outcome.measure: Acupuncture sensation measured by De-qi questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After needling on the 1st day visit
secondary_outcome.description: De-qi questionnaire (Kim et al.) will be used to evaluate acupuncture sensation.

secondary_outcome.measure: Acupuncture sensation measured by De-qi questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: After needle removal on the next day visit (1 day after needling)
secondary_outcome.description: De-qi questionnaire (Kim et al.) will be used to evaluate acupuncture sensation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: After needle removal on the next day visit (1 day after needling)
secondary_outcome.description: Blinding property will be evaluated: the participants will be asked 'which type of acupuncture do you think you have received?' and choose 1 answer out of real, sham, or don't know.

other_outcome.time_frame: After needling on the 1st day visit
other_outcome.description: A Korean version of Acupuncture Belief Scale (ABS), a 36-item self-report on a 5-point Likert scale will be used to evaluate acupuncture experiences and beliefs.
Tactile sensitivity will be measured using von Frey filament.

Using a modified method by Schandry, the participants will be asked to count their own heartbeats with eyes closed during the three counting phases that vary in length randomly, i.e. 25, 35, and 45 seconds. Beginning and end of a phase will be given verbally by the experimenter. Information on the length of the three counting phases will not be open to participants. Heart rate will also be recorded and analysed by a computer-based data acquisition system (MP150 data acquisition system, version 4.3.0, Biopac® Systems, Inc., Goleta, CA, USA).
EDA data will be obtained to evaluate autonomic response following acupuncture needling (MP150 data acquisition system, version 4.3.0, Biopac® Systems, Inc., Goleta, CA, USA).

other_outcome.time_frame: After needle removal on the next day visit (1 day after needling)
other_outcome.description: Credibility of the acupuncture treatment will be evaluated using a credibility test by Vincent et al.

arm_group.description: A sterilised stainless steel press needle that only has the ring-shaped head of needle without needle body has three layers of adhesive tape. Between the first and second layer is the head of needle to support needle body while maintaining identical appearance and the third layer is attached to skin. RS will be placed on 1 cm medial to acupoint LI11 and ear wrist, a non-specific control auricular acupoint used in the previous literature of the non-dominant side. An acupoint detector (personal TENS electronic acupuncture, Hammtek Korea, Seoul, Korea) will be used to locate points with lower skin impedance than those nearby.

A sterilised stainless steel press needle (diameter 0.18 mm X length 1.5 mm, Dongbang Acupuncture Inc., Boryeong, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea) has three layers of adhesive tape. Between the first and second layer is the head of needle to support needle body and the third layer is attached to skin. RN will be placed on acupoint LI11 and ear shenmen of the non-dominant side. An acupoint detector (personal TENS electronic acupuncture, Hammtek Korea, Seoul, Korea) will be used to locate points with lower skin impedance than those nearby.

A sterilised stainless steel press needle (diameter 0.18 mm X length 1.5 mm, Dongbang Acupuncture Inc., Boryeong, Chungcheongnam-do, Korea) with a blunted tip has three layers of adhesive tape. Between the first and second layer is the head of needle to support needle body while maintaining identical appearance and the third layer is attached to skin. KS will be placed on 1 cm medial to acupoint LI11 and ear wrist, a non-specific control auricular acupoint used in the previous literature of the non-dominant side. An acupoint detector (personal TENS electronic acupuncture, Hammtek Korea, Seoul, Korea) will be used to locate points with lower skin impedance than those nearby.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age over 18
- not participating in other clinical studies at the time of study participation
- voluntary participation
Exclusion Criteria:
- not satisfying the inclusion criteria
- pregnancy or breast-feeding at the time of study participation
- open sores or skin diseases on the non-dominant elbow or ear where needles would be placed
- having taken analgesics in 24 hours before participation
- any other diseases or conditions that might prevent the participant from receiving acupuncture

facility.name: Acupuncture & Meridian Science Research Centre, Kyung Hee University
